content.question: A researcher was interested in the relationship between a swimmerâ€™s hand length and corresponding time to complete the 100-meter freestyle. The researcher selected a random sample of twenty swimmers from all participants in a swim competition. Assuming all conditions for inference are met, which of the following significance tests should be used to investigate whether there is convincing evidence, at a 5 percent level of significance, that a longer hand length is associated with a decrease in the time to complete the 100-meter freestyle?

choices.label: A matched-pairs <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a mean difference
A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between means
A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between proportions
A linear regression <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for slope

content.answer: A linear regression <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for slope

topic.text: 9.4: Setting Up a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
